Based on the preferences and context cues given, I would recommend "The Scarlet Letter" as a reference movie. The story is set in Massachusetts in the 17th century. The main character, Hester Prynne, is forced to wear a scarlet "A" on her dress for bearing a child out of wedlock.
The film stars Academy Award winner Ralph Fiennes as Hester Prynne and Academy Award nominee Geoffrey Rush as Roger Chillingworth. The film also features Academy Award nominated Vanessa Redgrave as Elizabeth Lee, and Academy Award nominated Kevin Spacey as John Proctor.
"The Scarlet Letter" is a classic American novel by Nathaniel Hawthorne. The novel was first published in 1850. The novel tells the story of Hester Prynne who lives in the Massachusetts Bay Colony with her husband Roger Chillingworth.
